name: Pan Pacific Manila

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were large and clean. Service was exceptional. Security very tight. Food was very good.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, very helpful staff, would stay again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It can be a little tricky to get to. It is on a one way street and you enter the hotel going in the wrong direction. Oddly enough not every taxi driver was familiar with it's location. It is close enough to the US embassy as the crow flies but will still take about 10 minutes to get there.
reviews.title: A good choice in the area

reviews.text: Best thing about the hotel is the hotel staff, they are always willing to try to satisfy every request. Early check in and late check out were not a problem. Concierge was very helpful with providing printouts for documents I needed even when business office was closed. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great business hotel

reviews.text: Pan Pacific staff are top notch.
reviews.title: pool charges!!!

reviews.title: Nice hotel, watch out for hidden charges... I won't be back

reviews.text: Just had a glorious stay this Nov. 7 to 12, 2011. From the time we checked in (Hilda was very nice and helpful) until we checked out, it was a breeze. The staff made sure you were comfortable in your stay. My kids enjoyed swimming in the pool everyday and my husband enjoyed the gym thought he would much prefer less people in the gym.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and friendly staff.

reviews.text: Excellent hotel for a family vacation. Having Robinsons Place just a block away makes it better!
reviews.title: excellent hotel

reviews.text: I love the view from the restaurant (level 21) I go early every morning for breakfast just to take in and enjoy the beautiful view of the bay :) the breakfast was also wonderful so many food to choose from, love the juices (they even offered coconut juice for breakfast!)
reviews.title: Exceptional Customer Service! Great Hotel!

reviews.text: when I got there, they upgraded my room to a suite.. the room was very spacious, pure luxury for someone like me :) 3 flat screen tv (bedroom, livingroom and bathroom)
reviews.title: Great Hotel!!

reviews.text: the internet is free, wifi at the lobby is also free!!
reviews.title: the best hotel for me and my family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Manila during a brief stay in Manila just before heading to Palawan. The hotel was gorgeous and the staff was kind and helpful. Our room was luxurious, spacious, and super comfortable. The pool was a great spot to relax and swim. Plus, there's a great pool bar to enjoy their tropical drinks. I would definitely the Pan Pacific in Manila.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Manila

reviews.text: We had a great time at Pan Pacific, the service is excellent and the rooms are great. The breakfast is amazing. Relaxing around the pool area was one of our favourite things to do.
reviews.title: Pure Luxury!

reviews.text: Three of us stayed here June/July 2010, the night prior to leaving for our flight to the beach Island of Boracay. If i had known how spectacular the room and hotel would be and how inviting the hotel staff would be, I would have chosen to stay there after our return from Boracay Island as well.
reviews.title: First Class All The Way...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had no flaws that i could see. Upon registering, we were offered a complimentary cocktail. And since we arrived with some others..(they were not staying at that hotel) everyone in our party was happily accommodated with a juice or bottle of water. There was a personal butler at your service just standing at attention on every floor. If you needed something, all you had to do was ask. (this was my first experience with a butler hotel, it was nice) The room was spacious enough for a couple and our teenager. The bathroom had a separate hot tub and shower. Had complimentary bath robes and slippers, t.v in both the bathroom and bedroom. Internet in the room available too. (i think it was 10 bucks for 24 hrs or something) Restaurants galore located all over inside the hotel. Whatever the desire. ie...seafood, steak, or Japanese style restaurant. If you wanted something to eat quicker, then the main level had quite a few choices to walk up to and order take-out or eat in. It had nice restaurants on upper levels and 'sort of an American food court' on the main level. They have a pool but it rained when we were there so we didn't try it out.
reviews.title: Excellent service of Pan Pacific

reviews.text: The location was walking distance to Robinsons Mall. Huge air conditioned mall like a huge mall you'd find here in Chicago. Good deals. Also many places to eat within a block or two of the hotel. Was also centrally located by the nightlife district. easy to walk or quick cab ride from the front of the hotel to many night life spots.We didn't peruse the nightlife...but was told if i was going to, that it was safer to jump into a cab that the hotel puts you in. That cabbie would be safer and more willing to help you with what places you are most likely to enjoy yourself without any fear of ending up in a less desirable location and less safe.
reviews.title: Recommended! Amazing staff. Clean rooms.

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights whilst visiting Mania with a group of friends. All of us had a fantastic experience. They offer airport transfer which is convenient and probably cheaper than regular metered taxi. The room was great, staff friendly, view excellent and all facilities were very good. I would definitely recommend the breakfast buffet as the view from the top is spectacular. Also in the evenings the view is great and there is an open rooftop where you can enjoy a drink. This is a great place to relax whilst in a very busy city. We all felt very safe here.
reviews.title: Choose this hotel!!

reviews.text: Unlike most of the hotels i have checked in to this hotel doesn't make you stand in line. You get to sit down while papers are verified and put into order by a friendly staff. The whole procedure took less than five minutes which was a relief considering the long travel time I had.
reviews.title: Friendly tension free atmosphere in a business hotel

reviews.text: I would suggest looking at promo or free upgrades when you book at this hotel. I was lucky enough to avail of an upgrade which included free wifi/broadband internet (very essential nowadays),free local calls, free breakfast buffet and best of all an upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite-which included a sitting room/office and 3 tvs (yes,they have tv in the bathroom too). Room was really spacious and had a very relaxing atmosphere. It was always clean too-that is something that amaze me. During my 4 days of stay there i would go out of the room for lunch and it wouldn't matter if i am gone for just a couple of hours or so when i get back the room would be clean and my stuff in order. I never had to push the sign for them to make up the room.
reviews.title: Nice business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet had an excellent variety even on those days when they were fully booked. Do go early though. It could be a long wait for a table if they are fully booked and you have breakfast at 8:30am. Since it is a business hotel i see a lot of people as early as 7am.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm in a mad city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very near the mall which is an added plus if you have companions wanting to shop while you are at meetings. It is about 5-10 min walk to the nearest mall. It is relatively safe even at night if you dont mind the street children staring at you and wanting to catch your attention. The thing to do is ignore them,walk briskly and they will leave you alone. Do not try to be a nice guy and give one of them money. They will call their friends and then you'd end up giving more than you can afford.
reviews.title: A Philippine Jewel

description: Pan Pacific Manila Hotel is the first and finest luxury hotel in the Philippines that delivers the promise of royal treatment by providing all guests with impeccable 'Butler Service' - a unique concept of consolidated services associated with the utmost personalised care. Located at the heart of the historical and cultural district of Malate in Manila, Pan Pacific Manila Hotel is just a short drive from the city's convention, exhibition and business centres. It is just 8 kilometers away from the Ninoy Aquino International Airport.A business hotel, designed to offer a comfortable abode to business travellers with its excellent facilities and service, it has 236 all-executive rooms and 7 spacious function rooms that cater to the accurate needs of the most demanding clientele.Pan Pacific Manila was recently recognised as the Philippines' Leading Business Hotel at the 2008 World Travel Awards. The hotel also ranked 44th in the Conde Nast Traveler Magazine's 2008 Top 100 Readers' Choice Awards for Asia Hotels.
